intro: Ehretia hainanensis, commonly known as Hainan ehretia, is a flowering plant native to southern China, particularly Hainan Island. It belongs to the Elaeocarpaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
